DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Systemic Therapy Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identifies systemic therapeutic procedures administered as part of the first course of treatment at this and all other facilities.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Systemic therapeutic procedures administered as part of the first course of treatment at this and all other facilities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: (sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.

Concepts.definition: Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: (sis-TEM-ik) Affecting the entire body._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment: refer to FORDS for addtional instructions.]

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is unknown whether hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was recommended or administered because it is not stated in patient record; death certificate-only cases.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is unknown whether hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was recommended or administered because it is not stated in patient record; death certificate-only cases.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: It is unknown whether hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was recommended or administered because it is not stated in patient record; death certificate-only cases.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (i.e., comorbid conditions, advanced age).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Combination of endocrine surgery and/or radiation with a transplant procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Combination of endocrine surgery and/or radiation with a transplant procedure.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Combination of endocrine surgery and/or radiation with a transplant procedure. (combination of codes 30 and 10, 11, 12 or 20).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Endocrine surgery and/or endocrine radiation therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Endocrine surgery and/or endocrine radiation therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Endocrine surgery and/or endocrine radiation therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bone marrow transplant procedure was administered, but the type was not specified.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bone marrow transplant procedure was administered, but the type was not specified.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bone marrow transplant procedure was administered, but the type was not specified.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No transplant procedure or endocrine therapy was administered as part of first course therapy; diagnosed at autopsy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No transplant procedure or endocrine therapy was administered as part of first course therapy; diagnosed at autopsy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
No transplant procedure or endocrine therapy was administered as part of first course therapy;
diagnosed at autopsy

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian; refusal noted in patient record.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hematologic transplant and/or endocrine surgery/radiation was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of first-course therapy. No reason was stated in the patient record.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: (sis-TEM-ik) Affecting the entire body.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Summ--Transplnt/Endocr Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: If none of these procedures were administered then this item records the reason they were not performed. These include bone marrow transplants, stem cell harvests, surgical and/or radiation endocrine therapy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: FORDS Manual, Revised 2009
ReferenceDocuments.description: See FORDS Manual for specifications of codes and data entry rules.
